context: The Estonian word 'kala' means fish in English. It's a common noun referring to aquatic vertebrates with fins and gills that live in water. In Estonian, 'kala' is the singular form of the word. When pluralized, it becomes 'kalad'. The word can be used in various contexts such as referring to fish as food ('kalast valmistatud suppi' - soup made from fish), or when talking about fish in general ('kalad on väga head söögiks' - fish are very good for eating).
